pageTitle: Appendix C Short Message Service (SMS) (Sun Java System Messaging Server 6.3 Administration Guide)
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {34445=Prepend a prefix (for example, translating 8005551212 to +18005551212), 186266=(integer, seconds) The current history file is closed and a new one created every HASH_FILE_ROLLOVER_PERIOD seconds. By default, a value of 1800 seconds (30 minutes) is used., 19160=jdoe@siroe.com (Today’s meeting) The staff meeting is at 14:30 today in the big conference room., 34339=Strip non-numeric characters (for example, translating 800.555.1212 to 8005551212), 117206=By default, a value of 1024 is used for MAX_PAGES_PER_BIND. Note that the channel will also detect ESME_RTHROTTLED errors and adjust MAX_PAGES_PER_BIND during a single run of the channel accordingly., 19024=The staff meeting is at 14:30 today in the big conference room., 71293=1024, 142870=For instance, to send a test message to the North American subscriber with the subscriber number (800) 555-1212, you would address your email message to, 78902=(0 or 1) Specifies whether or not to convert email notifications to SMS notifications. Email notification messages must conform to RFCs 1892, 1893, 1894. The default value is 0., 88552=Note that RFC 2822 has deprecated the use of Resent- header lines., 40351=Date: Wed, 16 Dec 1992 16:13:27 -0700 (PDT), 40449=D: Wed 16:13, 159964=If it is a notification, then the SMS message is converted to an email Delivery Status Notification (DSN) as per RFC 1892-1894. Note that the ESMTP NOTIFY flags (RFC 1891) of the original email message will be honored (For example, if the SMS message is a “success” DSN but the original email message requested only “failure” notifications, then the SMS notification will be discarded)., 205958=(string, "INADDR_ANY" or dotted decimal IP address) The IP address of the network interface to listen to for inbound SMPP client connections on. May be either the string “INADDR_ANY” (all available interfaces) or an IP address in dotted decimal form. (For example, 193.168.100.1.) The default value is “INADDR_ANY”., 198907=(string, "INADDR_ANY" or dotted decimal IP address) The IP address of the network interface to listen to for inbound SMPP client connections. May be either the string “INADDR_ANY” (all available interfaces) or an IP address in dotted decimal form. (For example, 193.168.100.1) The default value is “INADDR_ANY”. Clustered HA configurations will need to set this value to correspond to the HA logical IP address., 88016=Note that RFC 2822 has deprecated the use of Reply-to: and Resent-reply-to: header lines., 19599=From:John Doe Subj:Today’s meeting Msg:The staff meeting is at 14:30 today in the big conference room.}
textBeforeTable: Table C–1 SMS Attributes The recognized attribute names and their usages are given in Table C–1. These attributes allow for per-recipient control over some channel options. /attribute1=value1/attribute2=value2/.../@sms.siroe.com in which local-part is either the SMS destination address (for example, a wireless phone number, pager ID, etc.) or an attribute-value pair list in the format: local-part@sms.siroe.com When the SMS channel is configured as per C.3 SMS Channel Configuration purposes of discussion, let us assume that the host name sms.siroe.com is a host name associated with the channel. In that case, email is directed to the channel with an address of the form: C.2.1 Directing Email to the Channel C.2.5 Site-defined Text Conversions C.2.4 Site-defined Address Validity Checks and Translations C.2.3 The SMS Message Submission Process. C.2.2 The Email to SMS Conversion Process. C.2.1 Directing Email to the Channel. The following channel operation topics are covered in this section: The SMS channel is a multi-threaded channel which converts queued email messages to SMS messages and then submits them for delivery to an SMSC. C.2 SMS Channel Theory of Operation For storage planning information for the SMS Gateway Server, see C.6 SMS Gateway Server Storage Requirements The SMSC must support SMPP V3.4, or later, over TCP/IP and there must
textAfterTable: FROM_TON Use the specified TON value. Ignored when option USE_HEADER_FROM=0. MAXLEN The maximum, total bytes (that is, eight bit bytes) to place into the generated SMS message or messages for this recipient. The lower value of either MAXLEN and the value specified by the MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE channel option is used. MAXPAGES The maximum number of SMS messages to split the email message into for this recipient. The lower value of either MAXPAGES and the value specified by the MAX_PAGES_PER_MESSAGE channel option is used. NPI Specify a Numeric Plan Indicator (NPI) value for the destination SMS address specified with the ID attribute. See the description of the DEFAULT_DESTINATION_NPI channel option for information on the accepted values for this attribute. When this attribute is used, its value overrides the value given by the DEFAULT_DESTINATION_NPI channel option. PAGELEN Maximum number of bytes to place into a single SMS message for this recipient. The minimum of this value and that specified with the MAX_PAGE_SIZE channel option is used. TO Synonym for ID.   TO_NPI
